items.sentence: The next time that I see Tom, I'm going to tell him that.
The house at the end of the street is supposedly haunted.
One of the magazines is for boys, the other is for girls.
A warm cup of cocoa is comforting on a cold winter night.
I thought that college would be a more interesting place.
Do you believe that I have a chance to get that position?
I don't think the Giants will be the champions this year.
No sooner had he struck the match than the bomb exploded.
The government made no move to solve the housing problem.
I wanted to catch the bird, but I found it too difficult.
I was held up on my way to the hospital in a traffic jam.
Tom called his parents, but they didn't answer the phone.
Ordinary folk like us understand nothing about it anyway.
Tom wasn't the only one who was late. Mary was late, too.
I don't think I can put up with this nonsense any longer.
I don't think Tom would be willing to lend his car to us.
Don't you think you're a bit old to go trick-or-treating?
It's surprising that you haven't heard anything from Tom.
Tom definitely doesn't speak French as well as Mary does.
It's never too late to start studying a foreign language.
